Sorry, I didn't mean to leave this unanswered :)
But then, I tried to give a brief problem statement in bug 429264, and now I'm clueless what exactly I should explain :) Please help me helping you.

Tests released here: http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?h=BETA_JAVA8&id=043ea43f7160bcc977063a59da0e2e6654585014
Stephan, when testing this in the IDE, (while hovering on comparing)
I see
<Person, String> Comparator<Person> java.util.Comparator.comparing(Function<? super Person, ? extends String> keyExtractor)
if the line is
Collections.sort(people, Comparator.comparing((Person p) -> p.getLastName()))
and
<Object, ?> Comparator<Object> java.util.Comparator.comparing(Function<? super Object, ? extends ?> keyExtractor)
if the line is:
Collections.sort(people, Comparator.comparing((p) -> p.getLastName()))
Can you confirm this is correct ? (No reason to suspect inference, just looking for affirmation that this is intentional and correct.)

(In reply to Srikanth Sankaran from comment #6) > Can you confirm this is correct ? (No reason to suspect inference, just > looking > for affirmation that this is intentional and correct.)
Hm, I wouldn't exactly expect this result.
I would have to dig a little deeper to see if this is an artifact of the stop-gap fix in KeyToSignature, or if inference isn't performed or what exactly. Note that hovering over "sort" correctly shows the 2nd argument as "Comparator<? super Person> c".
Let's come back once bug 429264 is resolved.

Verified as working for Eclipse + Java 8 RC2 using Kepler SR2 + Eclipse Java Development Tools Patch for Java 8 Support (BETA) 1.0.0.v20140306-1935
